definition: loose/to loosen/to relax/floss (dry, fluffy food product made from shredded, seasoned meat or fish, used as a topping or filling)
earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: The farmer tills the soil, plants, fertilizes, weeds, and waits for the rain.
sentences.chinese: 農夫鬆土，種植，施肥，除草，然後等待天降甘霖。

sentences.english: The paviours beetled the paving stones and loose earth.
sentences.chinese: 鋪路工夯實鋪路石和鬆土。

sentences.english: Every morning you can see him cultivating the corn.
sentences.chinese: 每天早晨你都可以看見他在給玉米鋤草鬆土。

sentences.english: Rain caused the loose dirt to pack.
Every morning you can see him cultivating the corn .
sentences.chinese: 每天早晨你都可以看見他在給玉米鋤草鬆土。

sentences.english: Hoe the wheat today, and the cotton tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 今天給小麥鬆土除草，明天鋤棉花。

sentences.english: Loosen the soil humus zone multi-birth, and shoots the best quality.
sentences.chinese: 多腐殖質的鬆土地帶出生的，筍質最好。

sentences.english: He is loosening the soil in his garden.
He chopped wood to make the fire, dug and weeded the little vegetable patch.
sentences.chinese: 他劈柴，生火，在小菜園裏鬆土並鋤草。

sentences.english: Quickly determine Bank, Compacted and Loose Soil Volumes for any job.
sentences.chinese: 快速確定銀行，壓實和鬆土量的任何工作。

definition: to bore/to burrow/to crawl through a tunnel
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
